intro: Liberbaileya lankawiensis, commonly known as the Lankawi bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom during the dry season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
